description: indigo-dyed cotton banner with inscription in Japanese characters in white; brown table or dais with two vases with fanned, pluming elements coming out of them; white cotton loop attachments
inscription: 愛宕山大権現 {Atago-yama dai-gongen} (Great Avatar of Mt. Atago); 當所　金井氏 {tōsho Kanai-uji} (this place, Kanai clan)
markings: bottom corner, verso: Murray Collection label: JAP 6108
text: This banner accompanied a gift of sake offered to the deity Atago Gongen, the Great Avatar of Mount Atago (Atago-yama dai-gongen). He is worshipped as a protector against fire, and many shrines are dedicated to him, particularly in the western part of Japan. The donors, the Kanai clan, are identified at the bottom, below a wooden platform tray used in Shinto rituals to hold offerings, on which two vases sit.
title: Festival banner invoking the deity Atago Gongen
